Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti of Tameret with a black lappet wig, a carved face, crossed brown hands holding red hoes, the legs inscribed with a central column of black painted hieroglyphs on a yellow ground bordered with red, the back is yellow and decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket and a yoke with two pendular nu-pots, the back of the legs is white overlain with a red cheque-pattern.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
